title: A Year After Hurricane Maria, Tradition Helps an Island Heal
description:
Over a year ago, Puerto Rico bore the brunt of Hurricane Maria's wrath. But the small Caribbean island of Dominica was also hit. David Meyers speaks with Bloomberg's Karen Toulon who recently visited the island. She spent time there as a child and reports how its traditions survived the storm as the island rebuilds. 
FOLLOW UP
Karen's latest: Hurricane Maria Leveled an Island But Left This Tradition Alive
You can follow Karen at: @karentoulon
---- 
TicToc is a daily news podcast hosted by David Meyers (@davidfmeyers), produced at Bloomberg Worldwide HQ in New York City. You can follow up with us and watch our reporting @tictoc. If you like it, be sure to rate us on iTunes, and tell your friends!
